review: My Fire TV box was great while it lasted - easy to setup, fast load times - worked with a wired and wireless connection, and had support for the content we were looking for (Prime, Netflix, HBO Go). However, the good times didn't last as long as I had hoped. Just a couple days ago, the box mysteriously decided not to display anything on the TV. I could see a monochrome Amazon logo come up on the TV when the box started but after that - zilch. I could hear the usual click sounds via the TV when I used the remote so something was definitely moving across my HDMI cables. I switched cables, switched HDMI ports, did all the usual resets - no luck.Finally my Amazon customer service call ended with a "your warranty period expired and we will give you a replacement for $50 instead of the retail price of $99". Tempting as it seemed, I didn't know how reliable these boxes were and didn't want to shell out another $50 right after the warranty expires again for the new box. Time to go buy a Roku I guess...but the Fire TV box was good while it lasted.
